Australia (1cropped).jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Bravo with [[Chile national football team|Chile]] in 2017 | fullname = Claudio Andrés Bravo Muñoz<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/84136|title=Squads for 2016/17 Premier League confirmed|publisher=Premier League|date=1 September 2016|accessdate=15 September 2016}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1983|4|13|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Buin, Chile|Viluco]], Chile | height = {{convert|1.84|m|ftin|0|abbr=on}}<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.premierleague.com/players/5810/Claudio-Bravo/overview|title=Claudio Bravo|publisher=Premier League|accessdate=18 August 2017}}</ref> | position = [[Goalkeeper (association football)|Goalkeeper]] | currentclub = [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] | clubnumber = 1 | youthyears1 = | youthclubs1 = [[Colo-Colo]] | years1 = 2002–2006 | clubs1 = [[Colo-Colo]] | caps1 = 123 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2006–2014 | clubs2 = [[Real Sociedad]] | caps2 = 229 | goals2 = 1 | years3 = 2014–2016 | clubs3 = [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] | caps3 = 70 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2016– | clubs4 = [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] | caps4 = 25 | goals4 = 0 | totalcaps = | totalgoals = | nationalyears1 = 2004 | nationalteam1 = [[Chile Olympic football team|Chile U23]] | nationalcaps1 = 7 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2004– | nationalteam2 = [[Chile national football team|Chile]] | nationalcaps2 = 119 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | club-update = 13 May 2018 | nationalteam-update = 10 October 2017 | medaltemplates = {{MedalCountry|{{fb|CHI}}}} {{MedalCompetition|[[Copa América]]}} {{Medal|W|[[2015 Copa América|2015 Chile]]|}} {{Medal|W|[[Copa América Centenario|2016 USA]]|}} {{MedalCompetition|[[FIFA Confederations Cup]]}} {{Medal|RU|[[2017 FIFA Confederations Cup|2017 Russia]]|}} }} '''Claudio Andrés Bravo Muñoz''' ({{IPA-es|ˈklauðjo ˈβɾaβo}}; born 13 April 1983) is a Chilean professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Goalkeeper (association football)|goalkeeper]] for {{English football updater|ManchesC}} club [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] and the [[Chile national football team|Chile national team]].
He started playing with [[Colo-Colo]] and moved to [[Real Sociedad]] in 2006, appearing in 237 official games with the latter club. [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] signed him for €12 million in 2014, and he won the [[Treble (association football)|treble]] and the [[Ricardo Zamora Trophy|Zamora Trophy]] in [[2014–15 La Liga|his first season]]. In the summer of 2016, he moved to [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]].
Bravo is [[Chile national football team|Chile]]'s second most capped player of all time, after [[Alexis Sánchez]], with over 115 appearances since his debut in 2004, and represented the nation in two [[FIFA World Cup|World Cups]], a [[FIFA Confederations Cup]] and five [[Copa América]] tournaments. He [[Captain (association football)|captained]] his side to victory at the [[2015 Copa América|2015]] and [[Copa América Centenario|2016 editions]] of the latter competition.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/confederationscup/news/y=2017/m=6/news=a-closer-look-at-the-confed-cup-captains-2895407.html|title=Meet the Confed Cup captains|publisher=FIFA|date=17 June 2017|accessdate=18 June 2017|quote=He [Claudio Bravo] was a key part of the teams that competed at the 2010 and 2014 World Cups and, as captain, had the honour of raising the Copa America trophy in 2015 and 2016.}}</ref>
==Club career== ===Colo-Colo=== Bravo was born in [[Buin, Chile|Viluco]], [[Maipo Province]]. His father recognized his son's emerging talent and took him to [[Colo-Colo]]'s youth academy, and he eventually made his professional debut in 2002. There, he was given the nickname ''Cóndor Chico'', after former club goalkeeper [[Roberto Rojas]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sport.net/getting-to-know-claudio-bravo_308059#|title=Getting to know Claudio Bravo|publisher=Sport.net|last=Cernensek|first=Bostjan|date=23 January 2015|accessdate=1 September 2016}}</ref>
After an injury to [[Eduardo Lobos]], manager [[Jaime Pizarro]] gave Bravo his first chance, which would be however short-lived, as he too was injured, which prompted the subsequent signing of [[Jonny Walker (soccer)|Jonny Walker]]. He recovered in mid-2003, and with Lobos still in the sidelines he took over the starting role which he would never lose again, with his competitor eventually being sold.
In 2006, Bravo won his first title, making an acrobatic save in the ''[[Apertura and Clausura|Apertura]]'''s [[Penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shootout]] final win against arch-rival [[C.F. Universidad de Chile]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.ferplei.com/2013/07/se-cumplen-siete-anos-del-cara-a-cara-entre-mayer-candelo-vs-claudio-bravo-video/|title=Se cumplen siete años del cara a cara entre Mayer Candelo vs Claudio Bravo [VIDEO]|trans-title=Faceoff between Mayer Candelo and Claudio Bravo was seven years ago [VIDEO]|publisher=Ferplei|language=es|date=2 July 2013|accessdate=6 July 2015}}</ref>
===Real Sociedad=== For the [[2006–07 La Liga|2006–07 season]], Bravo signed a five-year contract with [[Real Sociedad]] in Spain,<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.realsociedad.com//document/view/spa//57947/comunicado-oficial--principio-de-acuerdo-con-bravo | title = Comunicado oficial: Principio de acuerdo con Bravo | trans-title = Official announcement: Initial agreement with Bravo | publisher = Real Sociedad | language = es | date = 28 June 2006 | accessdate = 18 August 2013}}</ref> in a reported €1.2 million deal –<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.donostiasansebastian.com/noticias3.php?id=102 | title = La Real ficha al portero Claudio Bravo | trans-title = Real sign goalkeeper Claudio Bravo | publisher = Donostia San Sebastián | language = es | date = 21 June 2006 | accessdate = 8 May 2013}}</ref> he and [[Asier Riesgo]] formed the youngest pair of goalkeepers that year in [[La Liga]]. He started on [[Substitute (association football)|the bench]], but eventually gained the battle for first-choice (29 games to nine) as the [[Basque Country (autonomous community)|Basque]] side was relegated (despite this, he finished in fifth place for the [[Ricardo Zamora Trophy]] with a goal-against average of 1.00); his league debut came on 22 October 2006, in a 0–0 away draw against [[RCD Mallorca]].<ref>{{cite news | url = http://www.elmundo.es/elmundodeporte/2006/10/22/futbol/1161538421.html | title = Los palos salvan a la Real de otra derrota | trans-title = Posts prevent another Real loss | newspaper = [[El Mundo (Spain)|El Mundo]] | language = es | date = 22 October 2006 | accessdate = 21 June 2013}}</ref>
[[2007–08 Segunda División|The following season]], Riesgo reclaimed his starting position.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://archivo.marca.com/edicion/marca/futbol/2a_division/real_sociedad/es/desarrollo/1040758.html|title=Riesgo se pone 'Bravo'|trans-title=Riesgo gets all 'Brave' ("Bravo" in English)|newspaper=[[Marca (newspaper)|Marca]]|last=Badallo|first=Óscar|language=es|date=28 September 2007|accessdate=9 June 2016}}</ref> For [[2008–09 Segunda División|2008–09]], however, after a loan to the former to [[Recreativo de Huelva]], Bravo was again the starter, but Real remained in [[Segunda División]]. He was the joint-recipient of the campaign's Zamora, alongside [[David Cobeño]] of [[Rayo Vallecano]].<ref name=Perfect>{{cite news|url=http://chile.as.com/chile/2015/05/22/futbol/1432318909_260400.html|title=Claudio Bravo gana el 'Zamora' y se encamina al año perfecto|trans-title=Claudio Bravo wins the 'Zamora' and caps a perfect year|newspaper=[[Diario AS]]|last=Reyes|first=Luis|language=es|date=23 May 2015|accessdate=15 March 2016}}</ref>
On 24 January 2010, Bravo was [[Ejection (sports)|sent off]] for the first time in a loss to [[Elche CF]] at [[Anoeta Stadium]], fouling [[Óscar Trejo]] in the ninth minute, from which [[Jorge Molina Vidal|Jorge Molina]] scored a [[Penalty kick (association football)|penalty]] for the only goal of the game.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/2010/01/24/futbol/2adivision/1264360234.html|title=Un error de Bravo deja a la Real sin liderato|trans-title=Bravo's error takes the lead from Real|newspaper=Marca|language=es|date=24 January 2010|accessdate=15 March 2016}}</ref> Three weeks later, he scored the first goal of his career, from a [[direct free kick]] against [[Gimnàstic de Tarragona]], the game's only in a home triumph;<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.europapress.es/deportes/futbol-00162/noticia-futbol-liga-adelante-cronica-gol-portero-bravo-da-victoria-real-sociedad-nastic-20100214190407.html | title = (Crónica) Un gol del portero Bravo da la victoria a la Real Sociedad ante el Nástic | trans-title = (Report) Goal by goalkeeper Bravo gives win to Real Sociedad against Nástic | publisher = [[Europa Press (news agency)|Europa Press]] | language = es | date = 14 February 2010 | accessdate = 29 May 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PPKE3CmCKy0 | title = Gol de falta del portero Bravo – Real sociedad vs Nastic! | trans-title = Free kick goal from goalkeeper Bravo – Real sociedad vs Nastic! | publisher = [[YouTube]] | language = es | date = 14 February 2010 | accessdate = 8 May 2013}}</ref> however, shortly after, he suffered a severe knee injury during Real Sociedad's 0–2 loss at [[Córdoba CF]], which rendered him unavailable for the remainder of [[2009–10 Segunda División|the season]].<ref>{{cite news | url = http://www.marca.com/2010/03/30/futbol/equipos/real_sociedad/1269959532.html | title = Bravo: "Estoy triste por no poder ayudar al equipo" | trans-title = Bravo: "I'm sad for not being able to help the team" | newspaper = Marca | language = es | date = 30 March 2010 | accessdate = 8 May 2013}}</ref> He still featured in 25 matches to help his team finish champions and return to the top division, after three years.
===Barcelona=== [[File:Barça - Napoli - 20140806 - Claudio Bravo.jpg|thumb|150px|Bravo warming up for Barcelona in 2014]] Bravo joined [[FC Barcelona]] on 25 June 2014, with the four-year deal<ref name="Release">{{cite press release|url=https://www.fcbarcelona.com/football/first-team/news/2013-2014/agreement-for-claudio-bravo-to-join-fc-barcelona|title= Agreement for Claudio Bravo to join FC Barcelona|publisher=FC Barcelona|date=25 June 2014|access-date=2 July 2017}}</ref> being made effective on 1 July for a reported €12 million (£9.7 million) fee,<ref>{{cite news | url = http://www.marca.com/2014/06/18/futbol/equipos/barcelona/1403127536.html | title = Bravo ya es el tercer fichaje del Barcelona | trans-title = Bravo is already Barcelona's third signing | newspaper = Marca | last = Font | first = Sergi | language = es | date = 18 June 2014 | accessdate = 21 June 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.insidespanishfootball.com/112769/real-sociedad-and-barcelona-finalise-e12-million-transfer-of-claudio-bravo/ | title = Real Sociedad and Barcelona finalise €12 million transfer of Claudio Bravo | publisher = Inside Spanish Football | last = Conn | first = Tom | date = 18 June 2014 | accessdate = 20 June 2014 | deadurl = yes | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20140619165255/http://www.insidespanishfootball.com/112769/real-sociedad-and-barcelona-finalise-e12-million-transfer-of-claudio-bravo/ | archivedate = 19 June 2014 | df = dmy-all }}</ref> the fourth most expensive player ever sold by Real Sociedad after [[Darko Kovačević]], [[Xabi Alonso]] and [[Asier Illarramendi]], becoming the second Chilean to ever play for the club after [[Alexis Sánchez]] and succeeding [[Víctor Valdés]] as the first-choice. After joining, he set a Spanish League record for the club of not conceding from the start of season for 754 minutes, previously held by [[Pedro María Artola]] with 560 minutes; the streak was broken when he conceded his first goal of [[2014–15 La Liga|the season]] from the penalty spot to [[Cristiano Ronaldo]] in a 1–3 defeat to [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] at the [[Santiago Bernabéu Stadium|Santiago Bernabéu]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.com/football/first-team/detail/article/claudio-bravo-leaves-record-at-754-minutes|title=Claudio Bravo leaves record at 754 minutes|publisher=FC Barcelona|date=25 October 2014|accessdate=7 January 2015}}</ref>
After playing 37 straight league games, Bravo was rested for the last game of the campaign against [[Deportivo de La Coruña]], with [[Jordi Masip]] starting instead. The former was named as the goalkeeper in the La Liga Team of the Season as one of six Barcelona players, including three of his defenders.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3126163/Lionel-Messi-Cristiano-Ronaldo-lead-La-Liga-team-year-Gareth-Bale-misses-out.html|title=Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi lead La Liga team of the year... but there's no place for Gareth Bale after disappointing season|newspaper=[[Daily Mail]]|last=Skinner|first=Adam|date=17 June 2015|accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> He won the Zamora for the best goals against average in the competition, conceding 19 times for an average of 0.51, 0.04 off the all-time record by [[Francisco Liaño]] of Deportivo in 1994.<ref name=Zamora>{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.com/football/first-team/detail/article/claudio-bravo-wins-first-zamora-trophy|title=Claudio Bravo wins first Zamora Trophy|publisher=FC Barcelona|date=24 May 2015|accessdate=10 July 2015}}</ref>
After [[Marc-André ter Stegen]] was preferred for Barcelona's wins in the year's [[Copa del Rey]], [[UEFA Champions League]] and [[UEFA Super Cup]], Bravo made his cup debut for the team as they won the [[2015 FIFA Club World Cup]], keeping [[Shutout|clean sheets]] in their 3–0 wins over [[Guangzhou Evergrande Taobao F.C.]] and [[Club Atlético River Plate]] in Japan.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35141742|title=River Plate 0–3 Barcelona|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|last=Begley|first=Emlyn|date=20 December 2015|accessdate=13 March 2016}}</ref> Interviewed by [[Esport3]] on the subject of the rotation, he said "If I were to say that I'm taking it well, I would be lying, but I accept it".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/es-cl/news/4809/espa%C3%B1a/2015/11/02/16915842/claudio-bravo-y-su-incomodidad-con-la-rotaci%C3%B3n|title=Claudio Bravo y su incomodidad con la rotación|trans-title=Claudio Bravo and his discomfort with rotation|publisher=[[Goal (website)|Goal]]|language=es|date=2 November 2015|accessdate=26 March 2016}}</ref>
===Manchester City=== On 25 August 2016, Bravo signed a four-year deal for English club [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] for a reported fee of £17 million.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mancity.com/news/first-team/2016/08/25/claudio-bravo-signs-for-city/1472119073317|title=Claudio Bravo signs for City|publisher=Manchester City F.C|date=25 August 2016|access-date=25 August 2016|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160825142732/http://www.mancity.com/news/first-team/2016/08/25/claudio-bravo-signs-for-city/1472119073317|archivedate=25 August 2016|df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/story/2937222/claudio-bravo-completes-manchester-city-transfer-from-barcelona|title=Claudio Bravo completes Manchester City transfer from Barcelona|publisher=[[ESPN FC]]|date=25 August 2016|access-date=25 August 2016}}</ref> He made his debut on 10 September in a 2–1 triumph over [[Manchester derby|local]] rivals [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]],<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37263921|title=Manchester United 1–2 Manchester City|publisher=BBC Sport|last=McNulty|first=Phil|date=10 September 2016|accessdate=10 September 2016}}</ref> being at fault for the opposition's goal and receiving widespread criticism for his performance,<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2016/sep/10/pep-guardiola-claudio-bravo-horror-show-manchester-city-united|title=Pep Guardiola backs Claudio Bravo after serene start turns into horror show|newspaper=[[The Guardian]]|last=Jackson|first=Jamie|date=10 September 2016|accessdate=12 September 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2016/09/10/claudio-bravo-brutalised-by-gary-lineker-after-nightmare-debut-i/|title=Claudio Bravo brutalised on Twitter after nightmare debut in Manchester derby|newspaper=[[The Daily Telegraph]]|last=Davis|first=Callum|date=10 September 2016|accessdate=12 September 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.co.uk/english-premier-league/23/video/2947044/burley-claudio-bravo-poor-and-edgy|title=Burley: Claudio Bravo 'poor and edgy'|publisher=ESPN FC|date=10 September 2016|accessdate=12 September 2016}}</ref> although manager [[Pep Guardiola]] said that he had "one of the best performances I've ever seen".<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/1760701/manchester-derby-pep-guardiola-claims-claudio-bravos-shocker-was-one-of-the-best-performances-ive-ever-seen-after-clinching-2-1-triumph/|title=Bravo you hero – Manchester derby: Pep Guardiola claims Claudio Bravo’s shocker was ‘one of the best performances I've ever seen’ after clinching 2–1 triumph|newspaper=[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]|last=Shilton|first=Alec|date=10 September 2016|accessdate=12 September 2016}}</ref>
On his return to the [[Camp Nou]] on 19 October 2016, in a [[2016–17 UEFA Champions League|Champions League group stage match]], Bravo was [[Ejection (sports)|sent off]] after handling the ball outside of his area, in an eventual 0–4 loss.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37688076|title=Barcelona 4–0 Manchester City|publisher=BBC Sport|last=Lewis|first=Aimee|date=19 October 2016|accessdate=19 October 2016}}</ref> After a number of high profile errors, including being beaten by all six shots on target in his previous two appearances for City, he was dropped to the bench in February 2017, with backup [[Willy Caballero]] replacing him;<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/manchester-city/story/3052934/claudio-bravos-confidence-wont-be-affected-by-being-dropped-pep-guardiola|title=Claudio Bravo's confidence won't be hurt by being dropped – Pep Guardiola|publisher=ESPN FC|last=Smith|first=Jonathan|date=3 February 2017|access-date=8 September 2017}}</ref> having finished with the worst save success rate (54.1%) among all goalkeepers, he was named by many journalists as one of the worst signings of [[2016–17 Premier League|the season]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/who-scored-blog/2017/jan/17/claudio-bravo-worst-goalkeeper-premier-league-manchester-city|title=Claudio Bravo is not the only shot-stopper struggling in the Premier League|newspaper=The Guardian|last=Laurence|first=Martin|date=17 January 2017|access-date=8 September 2017|issn=0261-3077}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.football365.com/news/top-ten-worst-signings-of-the-premier-league-season|title=Top ten worst signings of the Premier League season|publisher=Football 365|last=Stead|first=Matthew|date=4 April 2017|access-date=8 September 2017}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.90min.com/posts/4913057-10-of-the-worst-premier-league-signings-this-season|title=10 of the worst Premier League signings this season|publisher=90 Min|last=Eyles|first=Cameron|date=24 April 2017|access-date=8 September 2017}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://bleacherreport.com/articles/2722261-manchester-city-transfer-news-pepe-reina-deal-expected-claudio-bravo-rumours|title=Manchester City transfer news: Pepe Reina deal expected, Claudio Bravo rumours|publisher=[[Bleacher Report]]|last=Clark|first=Gill|date=18 July 2017|access-date=8 September 2017}}</ref>
On 24 October 2017, after a [[2017–18 EFL Cup|0–0 home draw]] against [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] in the first 120 minutes of the [[EFL Cup]] fourth-round tie, Bravo saved two penalties to give his team a 4–1 win.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/oct/24/manchester-city-wolves-carabao-cup-match-report|title=Claudio Bravo’s two penalty saves help Manchester City past Wolves|newspaper=The Guardian|last=Jackson|first=Jamie|date=24 October 2017|access-date=24 October 2017|issn=0261-3077}}</ref> He ruptured his [[Achilles tendon]] in training the following August, going on to be sidelined for several months.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/claudio-bravo-injury-latest-manchester-city-news-a8500341.html|title=Manchester City goalkeeper Claudio Bravo faces lengthy spell on sidelines with Achilles injury|newspaper=[[The Independent]]|last=Critchley|first=Mark|date=20 August 2018|access-date=13 September 2018}}</ref>
==International career== [[File:Brazil vs. Chile in Mineirão 06.jpg|thumb|250px|Bravo in action against [[Brazil national football team|Brazil]] at the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]]]] Bravo represented [[Chile national football team|Chile]] at [[Chile national under-17 football team|under-17]], [[Chile national under-20 football team|under-20]] and [[Chile national under-23 football team|under-23 levels]]. He made his debut with the full side on 11 July 2004 against [[Paraguay national football team|Paraguay]] in the [[2004 Copa América]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rsssf.com/tables/2004safull.html|title=Copa América 2004|publisher=[[Rec.Sport.Soccer Statistics Foundation|RSSSF]]|accessdate=9 June 2016}}</ref> and retained his place for the rest of the [[2006 FIFA World Cup]] [[2006 FIFA World Cup qualification (CONMEBOL)|qualifiers]].
[[File:2017 Confederations Cup - Final - Claudio Bravo wins the Golden Glove.jpg|120px|thumb|left|Bravo holding the Golden Glove award at the [[2017 Confederations Cup]]]] Bravo was again called for duty in the [[2007 Copa América]] held in [[Venezuela]], where he started all four games.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.emol.com/noticias/deportes/2007/07/07/261883/el-baile-fue-ahora-en-la-cancha-brasil-goleo-6-1-a-chile.html|title=El baile fue ahora en la cancha: Brasil goleó 6–1 a Chile|trans-title=Dancing them on the pitch now: Brazil routed Chile 6–1|newspaper=[[El Mercurio]]|language=es|date=7 July 2007|accessdate=9 June 2016}}</ref> He became [[Captain (association football)|team captain]] after [[Marcelo Salas]] announced his international retirement.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://es.fifa.com/worldcup/news/y=2009/m=3/news=claudio-bravo-capitan-tiempo-completo-1037293.html|title=Claudio Bravo, capitán tiempo completo|trans-title=Claudio Bravo, full-time captain|publisher=FIFA|language=es|date=13 March 2009|accessdate=9 June 2016}}</ref> Rested for the final group game, he played three matches at the [[2011 Copa América]] as the country again reached the quarter-finals.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/2011/07/18/futbol/futbol_internacional/america/1310948530.html|title=Venezuela también se salta el guión|trans-title=Venezuela could not care less for script as well|newspaper=Marca|last=Melero|first=Delfín|language=es|date=18 July 2011|accessdate=9 June 2016}}</ref>
In the [[2010 FIFA World Cup|2010 World Cup]] in South Africa, Bravo started in all four matches for Chile (remaining as captain), conceding five goals in an eventual 0–3 [[Single-elimination tournament|round-of-16]] loss against [[Brazil national football team|Brazil]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/world_cup_2010/matches/match_54/default.stm|title=Brazil 3–0 Chile|publisher=BBC Sport|last=Fletcher|first=Paul|date=28 June 2010|accessdate=28 June 2014}}</ref> He was also selected by new manager [[Jorge Sampaoli]] to the squad of 23 for [[2014 FIFA World Cup|the following edition]],<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/chile/10810224/Chile-World-Cup-2014-squad.html|title=Chile World Cup 2014 squad|newspaper=The Daily Telegraph|date=2 June 2014|accessdate=28 June 2014}}</ref> starting all the games and conceding only four time – one by [[Australia national soccer team|Australia]], two by the [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]] and one by [[Brazil national football team|Brazil]] – which again ended in the same stage and at the hands of the same opponent, but in a penalty shootout.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/matches/round=255951/match=300186487/match-report.html|title=Brazil through as Chile pay the penalty|publisher=FIFA|date=28 June 2014|accessdate=28 June 2014}}</ref>
On 10 October 2014, in a [[Exhibition game|friendly]] 3–0 win against [[Peru national football team|Peru]], Bravo earned his 85th [[Cap (sport)|cap]], surpassing [[Leonel Sánchez]] as Chile's most capped player of all time.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.lacuarta.com/noticias/deportiva/2014/10/64-174546-9-claudio-bravo-fue-homenajeado-por-alcanzar-85-partidos-con-la-roja.shtml|title=Claudio Bravo fue homenajeado por alcanzar 85 partidos con la Roja|trans-title=Claudio Bravo was honoured for playing 85 games with ''La Roja''|newspaper=[[La Cuarta]]|language=es|date=11 October 2014|accessdate=6 April 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150708074437/http://www.lacuarta.com/noticias/deportiva/2014/10/64-174546-9-claudio-bravo-fue-homenajeado-por-alcanzar-85-partidos-con-la-roja.shtml|archive-date=8 July 2015|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> He was the captain and played every minute as they won the [[2015 Copa América]] on home soil, their first major international honour. In [[2015 Copa América Final|the final]] against [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]] at the [[Estadio Nacional Julio Martínez Prádanos|Estadio Nacional]], he kept a clean sheet as the match finished goalless after extra time, and then saved from [[Éver Banega]] in the subsequent penalty shootout;<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/jul/05/chile-argentina-copa-america-final-match-report|title=Hosts Chile stun Argentina to claim first Copa América title on penalties|newspaper=The Guardian|last=Wilson|first=Jonathan|date=5 July 2015|accessdate=5 July 2015}}</ref> he was subsequently chosen for the Team of the Tournament.<ref name=Tott>{{cite web|url=http://www.ca2015.com/en/gallery/copa-america-2015---team-of-the-tournament/1nqqmzngdosa911z9l2g8k8317/slide/13|title=Copa América 2015 – Team of the tournament|publisher=[[CONMEBOL]]|date=5 July 2015|accessdate=5 July 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150707200522/http://www.ca2015.com/en/gallery/copa-america-2015---team-of-the-tournament/1nqqmzngdosa911z9l2g8k8317/slide/13|archivedate=7 July 2015|df=}}</ref>
On 24 March 2016, Bravo became the first Chilean to win his [[List of footballers with 100 or more caps|100th cap]], in a 1–2 home loss to Argentina in [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification (CONMEBOL)|qualification]] for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup|2018 World Cup]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/es-cl/news/4768/selecci%C3%B3n/2016/03/24/21672432/claudio-bravo-cumpli%C3%B3-100-partidos-en-la-roja|title=Claudio Bravo cumplió 100 partidos en La Roja|trans-title=Claudio Bravo completed 100 matches for ''La Roja''|publisher=Goal|language=es|date=24 March 2016|accessdate=26 March 2016}}</ref> In [[Copa América Centenario Final|the final]] of the [[Copa América Centenario]] at the [[MetLife Stadium]], against the same opponent and also on penalties, he saved [[Lucas Biglia]]'s attempt in an eventual 4–2 win.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/jun/26/chile-win-copa-america-argentina-match-report-penalty-shoot-out|title=Chile win Copa América once again as Argentina title drought continues|newspaper=The Guardian|last=Timms|first=Aaron|date=27 June 2016|accessdate=27 June 2016}}</ref>
After sitting out the first two games at the [[2017 FIFA Confederations Cup]], due to fitness problems,<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/chile/story/3148054/chile-goalkeeper-claudio-bravo-fit-to-face-australia-at-confederations-cup|title=Chile goalkeeper Claudio Bravo fit to face Australia at Confederations Cup|publisher=ESPN FC|date=25 June 2017|accessdate=29 June 2017}}</ref> Bravo started for the remainder of the tournament in [[Russia]], notably saving three penalty shootout attempts in the semi-finals against [[Portugal national football team|Portugal]] (0–0 after 120 minutes).<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/blog/the-match/60/post/3144615/claudio-bravo-the-hero-as-chile-beat-portugal-on-penalties-in-confederations-cup-semifinal|title=Claudio Bravo superb as Chile beat Portugal on penalties to reach final|publisher=ESPN FC|date=28 June 2017|accessdate=29 June 2017}}</ref> Although his team lost out 1–0 to reigning World champions [[Germany national football team|Germany]] in [[2017 FIFA Confederations Cup Final|the final]], his performances saw him being chosen the competition's best goalkeeper.<ref name=FIFA>{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/confederationscup/news/y=2017/m=7/news=awards-list-dominated-by-victorious-germans-2900157.html|title=Awards list dominated by victorious Germans|publisher=FIFA|date=2 July 2017|accessdate=3 July 2017}}</ref>
===Peru controversy=== On 13 October 2015, Peru and Chile played a [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification (CONMEBOL)|2018 World Cup qualifier]] at the [[Estadio Nacional del Perú]]. The match ended 4–3 in favor of the latter, but offensive writings were found written in the home team's dressing room afterwards, reading: "RESPETO, POR AQUÍ PASÓ EL CAMPEÓN DE AMÉRICA" (Respect, America's champions were here). This event was criticised by the media in [[South America]],<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.infobae.com/2015/10/14/1762272-se-agrando-chile-desafiante-mensaje-el-vestuario-peru/|title=Se agrandó Chile: desafiante mensaje en el vestuario de Perú|trans-title=Chile got all tough: defiant message in Peru's dressing room|publisher=[[Infobae]]|language=es|date=14 October 2015|access-date=22 October 2018}}</ref> and two years later a witness revealed that Bravo was the one who had left this message;<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.minuto30.com/se-supo-cual-jugador-chileno-fue-el-que-rayo-el-camerino-en-peru/496616/|title=Se supo cuál jugador chileno fue el que rayó el camerino en Perú|trans-title=Chilean player who scratched dressing room in Peru identified|publisher=Minuto 30|language=es|date=12 October 2017|access-date=22 October 2018}}</ref> additionally, the player was caught on camera kicking a door after the match.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://peru.com/futbol/eliminatorias-rusia-2018/peru-vs-chile-claudio-bravo-revento-puerta-camerino-video-noticia-409614|title=Perú vs Chile: Claudio Bravo "reventó" puerta de camerino (VIDEO)|trans-title=Perú vs Chile: Claudio Bravo "exploded" dressing room door (VIDEO)|publisher=Peru.com|language=es|date=14 October 2015|access-date=22 October 2018}}</ref>
==Style of play== An authoritative presence in goal, Bravo is known for his leadership, agility, composure and shot-stopping ability, as well as his control, distribution and skill with the ball at his feet. Due to his speed when rushing off his line to anticipate opponents who have beaten the offside trap, he has been described as a ''[[Goalkeeper (association football)#Sweeper-keeper|sweeper keeper]]''; he has also been labelled as a [[Playmaker#Playmaking in other positions|playmaking goalkeeper]], due to his ability to play the ball out from the back or launch attacks from goal-kicks.<ref name="Release"/><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37610692|title='Man City's Claudio Bravo is a playmaker not sweeper-keeper'|publisher=BBC Sport|last=Brown-Finnis|first=Rachel|date=13 October 2016|accessdate=11 December 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/spanish-primera-division/15/blog/post/2940293/how-marc-andre-ter-stegen-beat-claudio-bravo-for-barcelona-goalkeeper-job|title=Marc-Andre ter Stegen shows why he won the Barcelona goalkeeper job|publisher=ESPN FC|last=Hunter|first=Graham|date=30 August 2016|accessdate=2 November 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espn.com/soccer/english-premier-league/23/blog/post/3300856/man-city-keeper-ederson-as-important-as-david-de-gea-is-for-man-united|title=Man City keeper Ederson as important as David De Gea is for Man United|publisher=ESPN FC|last=Ogden|first=Mark|date=8 December 2017|accessdate=17 January 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.thescore.com/liga/news/1289056-perfect-player-series-building-a-flawless-goalkeeper|title=Perfect player series: Building a flawless goalkeeper|publisher=The Score|last=Nesci|first=Gianluca|date=24 July 2017|accessdate=17 January 2018}}</ref>
